subject: Hiring and Promotion
Baseball
lead_paragraph: Nolan Ryan was hired as president of the Texas Rangers, reuniting him with the struggling team he pitched for at the end of his career.The Rangers introduced Ryan, a 61-year-old Texas native, with the fanfare of a major free-agent signing, taking him into a packed stadium hall that cheered after a highlight video trumpeted the return of the Ryan Express.“I’ve known since I was a player that I’d like to be involved in the shaping of an organization,” said Ryan, the major league’s career strikeout leader. “This gives me that opportunity.”Ryan threw seven no-hitters and won 324 games in a record 27 major league seasons. The last five of those were with the Rangers and included his final two no-hitters and 5,000th career strikeout.Ryan replaces Jeff Cogen, who was moved by the owner Tom Hicks to the Dallas Stars during a shake-up of his N.H.L. hockey team in November.
